snippet: A damaging and unnecessary crisis could easily have been stopped, but the House speaker refused.
abstract: Editorial blames the government shutdown on Speaker John Boehner's failure to lead; contends that Republicans are now desperate to make it appear as if Pres Obama and the Democrats are the ones being intransigent; maintains that the public's anger over this entirely unnecessary crisis should be aimed at the Republican Party and Boehner, who are incapable of governing.
lead_paragraph: A damaging and unnecessary crisis could easily have been stopped, but the House speaker refused.
